(a) find the work done by the engine of the car as the car travels from a to b.(4) when the car is at b and travelling at a speed of 14ms–1 the rate of working of the engine of the car is suddenly increased to p kw, resulting in an initial acceleration of the car of 0.7 m s–2.  the resistance to motion from non-gravitational forces still has a constant magnitude of 800 n. (b) find the value of p.(4)

(a) find the work done against friction as p moves from a to b.(4) (b) find the total potential energy lost by the system as p moves from a to b.(3) (c) find, using the work-energy principle, the speed of p as it passes through b.(4)
